00004 const int TEST_SQWAVE=1;
00005 const int TEST_SINWAVE=2;

00008 
00021 template <typename T> int detect_edges(cimg_library::CImg<T> &data,
00022                                        cimg_library::CImg<int> &raising_separation,
00023                                        cimg_library::CImg<int> &falling_separation,
00024                                        cimg_library::CImg<int> &duration,
00025                                        int threshold, int verbose)
00026 {
00028   cimg_library::CImg<int>     clean          = data.get_threshold(threshold);
00029   cimg_library::CImgList<int> gcleanlist     = clean.get_gradient("x",1);
00030   cimg_library::CImg<int>     clean_gradient = gcleanlist(0);
00031 
00032   cimg_library::CImg<int>     raisingedges;
00033   cimg_library::CImg<int>     fallingedges;
00034     
00035   int raising_count = 0;
00036   int falling_count = 0;
00037   int separation_count = 0; // for duration
00038 
00039   raisingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00040   fallingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00041   duration.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00042 
00043   cimg_forX(clean_gradient,s){
00044 
00045     if(clean_gradient(s)==1){
00046       raisingedges(raising_count)=s;
00047       raising_count++;
00048       separation_count=0; // this set to be zero when edge raise
00049     }
00050 
00051     if(clean_gradient(s)==-1){
00052       fallingedges(falling_count)=s;
00053       duration(falling_count)=separation_count; // duration is appended when edge falls
00054       falling_count++;
00055     }
00056     separation_count++; // increase duration count
00057   }
00058 
00059   raisingedges.crop(0,raising_count-1);
00060   fallingedges.crop(0,falling_count-1);
00061   duration.crop(0,falling_count-1);
00062 
00063 //data.display_graph("data");
00064 //clean.display_graph("clean");
00065 //clean_gradient.display_graph("clean gradient");
00066 //raisingedges.print("raising edges").display_graph("raising edges");
00067 
00068   //taking gradient to have the separation
00069   cimg_library::CImgList<int> grad_raisingedge_list=raisingedges.get_gradient("x",1);
00070   raising_separation = grad_raisingedge_list(0);
00071   raising_separation.crop(0,raising_separation.width()-2); // because of the forward finite difference
00072 
00073   cimg_library::CImgList<int> grad_fallingedge_list=fallingedges.get_gradient("x",1);
00074   falling_separation = grad_fallingedge_list(0);
00075   falling_separation.crop(0,falling_separation.width()-2);
00076 
00077   return 0;
00078 }

00102 int test_print_instruction(int sw)
00103 {
00104   if (sw==TEST_SQWAVE){
00105     std::cout<<"You are testing DAQ with square wave."<<std::endl;
00106     std::cout<<"This test assumes that the 1 kHz square wave comes into channel 0 with a 100 us duration."<<std::endl;
00107 //    std::cout<<"Press enter when it is ready."<<std::endl;
00108   }
00109 //  std::cin.get();
00110   return 0;
00111 }

00131 int test_square_wave(cimg_library::CImg<int> data, int sampling_rate)
00132 {
00133 std::cerr<<__FILE__<<"/"<<__func__<<std::flush;
00134   //cimg_library::CImg<int> sdata=data.get_crop(0,0,0,data.height()-1);
00135   //sdata.permute_axes("yzcx");
00136   cimg_library::CImg<int> raising_sep;  
00137   cimg_library::CImg<int> falling_sep;  
00138   cimg_library::CImg<int> duration;  
00139 
00140   detect_edges(data,raising_sep,falling_sep,duration,2.5,1);
00141   //std::cerr << "sampling_rate" <<sampling_rate;
00142   //raising_sep.print("raising_sep").display_graph("raising_sep");
00143 
00144   std::cout<<"###RESULT OF THE SQWAVE TEST###"<<std::endl;
00145   std::cout<<"raising_edge_separation:"<<std::endl;
00146   std::cout
00147     <<"count: "<<raising_sep.size()<<" samples"
00148     <<",mean: "<<1e3*raising_sep.mean()/sampling_rate<<" ms"
00149     <<", std: "<<1e6*sqrt(raising_sep.variance())/sampling_rate<<" us"
00150     <<", min: "<<1e3*(double)(raising_sep.min()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" ms"
00151     <<", max: "<<1e3*(double)(raising_sep.max()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" ms"
00152     <<std::endl;
00153   std::cout<<"falling_edge_separation:"<<std::endl;
00154   std::cout
00155     <<"count: "<<falling_sep.size()<<" samples"
00156     <<"mean: "<<1e3*falling_sep.mean()/sampling_rate<<" ms"
00157     <<", std: "<<1e6*sqrt(falling_sep.variance())/sampling_rate<<" us"
00158     <<", min: "<<1e3*(double)(falling_sep.min()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" ms"
00159     <<", max: "<<1e3*(double)(falling_sep.max()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" ms"
00160     <<std::endl;
00161   std::cout<<"duration:"<<std::endl;
00162   std::cout
00163     <<"count: "<<duration.size()<<" samples"
00164     <<"mean: "<<1e6*duration.mean()/sampling_rate<<" us"
00165     <<", std: "<<1e6*sqrt(duration.variance())/sampling_rate<<" us"
00166     <<", min: "<<1e6*(double)(duration.min()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" us"
00167     <<", max: "<<1e6*(double)(duration.max()/(double)sampling_rate)<<" us"
00168     <<std::endl;
00169   std::cout<<"###############################"<<std::endl;
00170 
00171   return 0;
00172 }
00173 
00174 int test_square_wave(cimg_library::CImgList<int> data, int sampling_rate)
00175 {
00176   
00178   cimglist_for(data,n) test_square_wave(data[n],sampling_rate);
00179   return 0;
00180 }
